etymology.description: 酉(酉) (yǒu, "drink") + 將(將) (jiāng, "lead") = liquid for cooking or drinking -> sauce
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the idea of fermented liquids, like those used in drink, with a phonetic hint from 將(將) (jiāng, "lead"), suggesting a mixture or preparation, which fits the concept of a sauce.
etymology.simplification: 醬(醬) simplified to 酱(酱) by replacing 將(將) (jiāng, "lead") with its cursive form 丬(丬) (pán, "half tree trunk") and 夕(夕) (xī, "evening") for phonetic similarity.

examples.chinese: 这瓶酱很好吃(這瓶醬很好吃)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè píng jiàng hěn hǎo chī.
examples.english: This bottle of sauce is delicious.

examples.chinese: 妈妈做菜时(媽媽做菜時)，总喜欢用自制的酱(總喜歡用自製的醬)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zuò cài shí, zǒng xǐhuān yòng zì zhì de jiàng.
examples.english: When cooking, mom always likes using homemade sauce.

examples.chinese: 厨房里的酱香浓郁(廚房裡的醬香濃郁)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng lǐ de jiàng xiāng nóng yù.
examples.english: The aroma of the sauce in the kitchen is rich.
